en: At the confluence of the shores of the Mediterranean and the hillsides of the Rhone Valley, GALLICIAN SIGNATURE wines are the fruit of a love story between men and the land, between the Costières and the lakeside areas of the Camargue, between the southern sun and the northern wind. Telling the story of the Cave de Gallician means telling the story of the attachment of the winegrowers to an exceptional terroir, destined since time immemorial to produce wines of excellence. It is the story of the rigorous selection of grape varieties and plots of land, the age-old know-how of grape cultivation and the respect of demanding contemporary specifications, the choice of the best equipment and the goldsmith's work of vinification... to finally reveal the marvellous flavours of the wines of Gallician. Founded in 1951, the Cave Pilote de Gallician brings together on its terroir located at the southern end of the Costière, about fifty winegrowers spread over approximately 800 hectares. The Gallician cellar has a pleasant sales cellar where you can discover a wide range of wines, local products and many gift ideas... Open from Monday to Saturday from 8am to 12pm and from 2pm to 6pm. Closed on Sundays and public holidays. AOP Costières de Nîmes The AOP Costières de Nîmes expresses the unique character of a terroir in the Rhone Valley. Situated on a vast terrace of rolled pebbles deposited by the Rhône and the Durance, it is the most southern of the Rhône vineyards. The Costières de Nîmes reds and rosés are mainly made from the Syrah grape variety, harmoniously blended with later grape varieties such as Grenache and Mourvèdre. Fine and tasty reds, fruity and bright rosés, fresh and delicate whites: these wines have in common the southern, fiery and resolutely festive character that is the hallmark of their origin! IGP Pays d'Oc Pays d'Oc wines are fruity and innovative, elegant and modern or refined and contemporary. They can be enjoyed at any time, at any place and at any table. Beyond their unique quality-price ratio, the wines of Pays d'Oc are resolutely attractive.
fr: A la confluence des rivages de la Méditerranée et des coteaux de la Vallée du Rhône, les vins GALLICIAN SIGNATURE sont le fruit d’une histoire d’amour entre les hommes et la terre, entre les Costières et les espaces lacustres de Camargue, entre le soleil du Sud et le vent du Nord. Raconter l’histoire de la Cave de Gallician, c’est raconter l’attachement des vignerons pour un terroir d’exception, destiné de tout temps à produire des vins d’excellence. C’est raconter la sélection rigoureuse des cépages et des parcelles, le savoir-faire millénaire de la culture du raisin et le respect d’un cahier des charges contemporain exigeant, le choix des meilleurs équipements et le travail d’orfèvre de la vinification… pour enfin révéler les saveurs merveilleuses des vins de Gallician. Fonndée en 1951, la Cave Pilote de Gallician regroupe sur son terroir situé à l'extrémité sud de la Costière, une cinquantaine de viticulteurs répartis sur environ 800 hectares. La cave de Gallician dispose d'un agréable caveau de vente où vous pourrez découvrir une gamme très étendue de vins, de produits du terroir ainsi que de nombreuses idées cadeaux... Ouvert du lundi au samedi de 8h00 à 12h00 et de 14h00 à 18h00. Fermé dimanche et jours fériés. AOP Costières de Nîmes L’ AOP Costières de Nîmes traduit le caractère singulier d’un terroir inscrit dans la Vallée du Rhône. Située sur une vaste terrasse de galets roulés déposés par le Rhône et la Durance, c’est le plus méridional des vignobles rhodaniens. Les Costières de Nîmes rouges et rosés sont majoritairement issus du cépage syrah, harmonieusement assemblé à des cépages plus tardifs tels que grenache et mourvèdre. Des rouges fins et savoureux, des rosés fruités et éclatants, des blancs frais et délicats : ces vins ont en commun ce caractère méridional, fougueux et résolument festif qui signe leur origine !IGP Pays d'Oc Les vins de pays d'Oc sont fruités et novateurs, élégants et modernes ou raffinés et contemporains. Ils se prêtent à tous les instants, toutes les envies et s'invitent à toutes les tables. Au delà de leur rapport qualité prix unique, les vins de pays d'Oc sont résolument attractifs.

Telling the story of the Cave de Gallician means telling the story of the attachment of the winegrowers to an exceptional terroir, destined since time immemorial to produce wines of excellence. Founded in 1951, the Cave Pilote de Gallician brings together on its terroir located at the southern end of the Costière, about fifty winegrowers spread over approximately 800 hectares. The Gallician cellar has a pleasant sales cellar where you can discover a very wide range of wines, local products and many gift ideas..

Open from Monday to Saturday from 8am to 12pm and from 2pm to 6pm. Closed on Sundays and public holidays.

Situated on a vast terrace of rolled pebbles deposited by the Rhône and the Durance, it is the most southern of the Rhône vineyards. The Costières de Nîmes reds and rosés are mainly made from the Syrah grape variety, harmoniously blended with later grape varieties such as Grenache and Mourvèdre. Fine and tasty reds, fruity and bright rosés, fresh and delicate whites: these wines have in common this southern, fiery and resolutely festive character which is the sign of their origin!

PGI Pays d'Oc
Pays d'Oc wines are fruity and innovative, elegant and modern or refined and contemporary. They can be enjoyed at any time, for any occasion and at any table. Beyond their unique quality-price ratio, the wines of Pays d'Oc are resolutely attractive.
